name: prefix
question: How do I change the prefix of the bot?
answer:
You can do `!config prefix -` to change the prefix.
If you don't know your current prefix, you can do `@InviteManager prefix` to see the prefix.

name: channel
question: How do I change the prefix of the bot?
answer: Set the channel by doing `!config joinMessageChannel #channel` or `!config leaveMessageChannel #channel`. After doing that, new joins and leaves will be posted to that channel.

name: message
question: Can I customize join and leave messages?
answer:
Absolutely!
You can change the message by doing for example
`!config joinMessage {memberMention} **joined**; Invited by **{inviterName}** (**{numInvites}** invites)` or 
`!config leaveMessage {memberName} **left**; Invited by **{inviterName}**`.
You can find a full list of all available placeholders here: https://github.com/AndreasGassmann/discord-invite-manager/

name: ranks
question: What are "Ranks" and how can I use them?
answer:
Ranks are used to assign roles to people when they reach a certain amount of invites. For example. if you have a role called `@Beginner` and you want people who have 5 or more invites to be added to that role, you would have to create a rank for that like so:
`!add-rank @Beginner 5 (and if you want a description here)`.
As soon as someone has 5 invites, he will automatically be added to that role!

name: bonus
question: What are bonus invites?
answer:
Bonus invites are invites that can be given to members by an admin. You can either increase or decrease the number of invites. You can also give a reason why you did it, like if someone was helpful or if someone broke the rules.
`!add-invites @user 5 Was very helpful!`.
Use negative number eg. `-5` to decrease the value of someone.
You can see how why someone has bonus invites by doing `!info @user`

name: removeInvites
question: How do I remove invites of someone?
answer:
You can use the `!add-invites` command with a negative number to do that (and also add an optional reason why you did it).
`!add-invites @user -5 Broke the rules.`

name: restrictChannel
question: How can I disable the bot in all but one/some channels?
answer: Take away the read message permissions in the channels where you don't want the bot to reply.

name: hideFromLeaderboard
question: How do I hide people from leaderboard?
answer: You can do `!memberConfig hideFromLeaderboard @user true` to hide a specific member from the leaderboard.

name: fake
question: How can I see cheaters on my server?
answer: The `!fake` command will show people who repeatedly joined your server.
